rock climbing along the side of the pastaza river. fun!

hiking trip to see some pretty lakes and a pretty mountain with glaciers

bolivias best guitar player absolutely ripping. loves playing cold play

walking around the most famous buildings in the city
met an older veterinarian who intorduced me to some animals and let me hold them. followed by him telling me about indigenous tribes lifestyles and manatee conservation

short day trip to go to the cute town nearby and see some touristy shops and beaches
hiked out to an unpopulated area of the beach to hang out and have a little mushroom trip

walked out to a lovely beach with a cute little bar. We took some shrooms and enjoyed the vibes and met some nice people
bjj class at my favorite gym in brasil. lovely people

a famous open air art gallery spread across multiple acres of land

went an hung out at the famous local waterfall where you can slide down into the pool below

baile funke party

saw baby sharks, tutrles and one big stingray
saw lots of fish, krill and watched a mum and baby sea lion interact
saw some penguins, and swam with some sea lions
first time outside concha and had a mini tour with a local named jose. saw so much stuff, rays and swam through a hidden grieta
bit of a snorkel outside but got spooked swimming alone
hiked to the wall of tears, view points, mangroves and lava tunnels
quick snorkel with the american student and family I started living with for a while
snorkel at low tide to see a lot of stingrays
snorkel with bad visibility, many turtles
snorkel with mediocre visibility. almost hit a stingray. finally saw octopuses

snorkeling with the whole group out past concha. swam with a shark
snorkel to see a pile of sea pancakes
learned how to make some ceviche with the local guys
watched some sea lions play
played with a whole family of sea lions
walked in the heat to visit a mediocre beach to hang out at
gitta and i swam with more sea lions and gave one a lemon to play with
hanging out at a natural bridge covered by natural spring fed pools
went to the biggest market in guatemala to wander around
paddle boarding to see volcano atitlan and relax in the sun
sunrise paddle boarding session that ended in bad winds and a boat having to save two girls in the water
calm morning led yoga practice to relax after the chaos
really warm water and lots of sea grass before seeingsome dead coral, then live coral and a beautiful blue drop off
terrible walk into the water and then some lovely coral reefs and fish
relaxing day walking to get to a crater lake, then relaxing in the water
drove around a bit enjoying the scooter and seeing some towns
looped around the whole island on paved and dirt roads
first surf in a while. didn't go so great
surf went better, but the waves closed out quite aggresively. playa amarillo
last surf in gigante, and it went best out of all of them. caught a few
first surf in transito. got some help from the argentinian guy to find nice waves. caught some good ones
relaxing yoga session
got crushed set after set after set. not a day I enjoyed
relaxing yoga session with some breath work after
nice long session enjoying the chill waves and non crushing sets. Caught a few nice ones. piece of shit board that was already a bit broken broke more.
relaxing yoga session with some breath work after
relaxing yoga session with some breath work after
camping on the top of volcán conchagua for the night to enjoy the view of the 3 countries, the stars and the cloud covered sunrise
hedge maze that I finished in 25min. was super fun!
night market with people from the bambu hostel and the lovely hostel owner luis!
morning surf as emotional support and eating sets on my head. luca's extra board
afternoon surf where I caught two not so bad waves. luca's extra board
did the walk along table mountain with Deon and Jadon. It was quite windy, nice views though
penguins everywhere waddling! so cute!
I was not hungover - gary was. we caught some fish, and we hung out with a massive pod of common dolphins as the swam with our boat!
lovely walk along the cliffs from pinnacle point to almost mossel bay. walked about 12.5km and ran 3km
rochelle and i hiked up to a nice viewpoint just outside of george. it was straight up, but really nice. had an amazing time
relaxing walk through the woods listening to birds. pulled myself across a river on a pontoon
5 km hike on the robberg peninsula to see the fur seals, dunes and a little island

an incredible multi day hike along the amazing coast of south africa with beautiful weather, tough uphills and some interesting river crossings. had an amazing time hiking with marco. 45 kms with an extra 3km to get a cold beer
a relaxed walk along the river mouth and over the suspension bridges
spent an hour kayaking through a nice calm river with marco - with savannas too
donned my fancy old wetsuit, rented a hard top longboard and headed out to catch somewaves
went for a quick sunset drive, saw some elephants, some bucks and some lions (and almost a car pile up to see them)
almost 11 hours in the parks searching for everything. saw lots of elephants very close, far away lions, rhinos in the distance, j walking buffalo, tree meerkats, one dung beetle and much more
short game drive in a private park. felt like they just dumped all the animals in one spot - saw lots, but it felt unnatural.
short little walk to see the valley. very serene until the baboons came along screaming
nice hike up to a lookout over the valley and the drakensburg. what an amazing view
walk along the boardwalk in ballito. this town is all white walls and fences. i find it unfriendly
beautiful landscapes and drive. lots of buffalo, and i got within metres of them, but not much else
quick drive into the park, saw some game and cute warthogs running around

activity: imfolozi full day game drive minus one tire
explaination: got to see cheetahs! met some nice people that drove me around for a bit. gave the car a belly rub on  some rocks and sliced the tires up
stayed to the tar. right at the beginning of the drive saw a pack of wild dogs on the road. saw lots of nyala and other antelope. saw some elephants from afar.

activity: hluhluwe game drive with the pensioners
explaination: hopped into a pensioners car for a day drive. did lots of birding, saw a few rhino and got close to lots of buffalo. on the way back to the gate saw the pack of wild dogs again, playing, laying and running around
shorter drive, saw lots of antelope

activity: imfolozi last chance drive for cheetahs
explaination: risked my tires to see three cheetah running about and playing close to the road
nice trail through a gorge along a river. met a girl along the way and hiked with her
beautiful landscapes with red grass on the mountains and stunning rock formatiosn, plus a stop into the dinosaur museum
hyena roadside, lots of elephants, some cute vervets, munching giraffes and 2 lions laying in the bush

activity: game drive from satara to lower sabie
explaination: road blocking giraffe, cute baby elephants at the watering hole, lots of waterbok, kori bustard, lots of zebra bums, monitor lizards and hippos at sunset

activity: game drive from lower sabie to croc bridge
explaination: first leopard sighting ever. watched it hunt an injured warthog for 30min. another leopard laying by the river kudu, baboons, some great eagle sightings, some fun hippos in the waterholes, more giraffes munching, and some lions napping after a kill

fat bellied lions right on the road within feet of my car in the morning. hippos fighting in the water, buffalo and lots of zebra, huge herd of buffalo stampeding to the river, cheetahs laying in the grass, and later running away, ostrich sighting, secretary bird, some southern ground hornbills, a lioness walking along the dam and many elephants

snoozing mating lions, spoonbills and crocs, closely munching giraffes and elephants, lots of kudu, vervets ripping apart bugs, pajama donkeys. multiple attempts to see leopards with kills. watched some dead animals for a really long time until i finally saw a leopard
giraffe silhouttes at sunrise, three leopards snoozing, eating a kill and jumping around the tree branches. some more giraffe and buffalo, mongoose and a lot of bird action at a hide
hit all the main tourist spots and views on the route. some nice waterfalls and gorgeous view
not much seen, some antelope, kilpspringer and a baby duiker that let us get close

activity: game drive pretoriuskop to berg en dal
explaination: leopard walked right in front of our car. some great giraffes, some neck fighting, one drooling, and some wee fresh little babies. some adorable baby hyenas crawling around chewing things, many zebra, more young hyenas walkng along the road, poached rhino getting eaten by hyena and vulture, a leopard with a kill in a tree right above the road

activity: game drive berg en dal to lower sabie
explaination: amazing sighting of a rhino pair, more hyena roadside, giraffe, elephant, cute baby zebras and cool eagles, great fish eagel sighting, saw some giraffes trying to mate and some monitor lizards fighting. had a mock elephant charge

activity: game drive lower sabie to satara
explaination: big group of marabou stork flying around, big group of buffalo with calves, some big elephants, more hyena pups of varying ages in the ditches, close up with a slender tail mongoose, group of lionesses with a few cubs around sunset
final glimpses of antelope, elephant and giraffe for a while

moto taxied up into the mountains and did a loop of the plateau. got a bit lost on the trails, but at some point made our way back down along the main wood collecting route. guys where carrying whole trees down
crawled along the rocks to get a view over the lake. beautiful. but i have never see so much shit in my life. it was everywhere. everywhere.
kayaked to a little island while the other took turns swimming. snorkeled with some beautiful colourful fish

multi day trip from the south of lake malawi to the north sleeping a tent on the top deck. spent the time chatting with friends, meeting locals and embroidering things. meg, moses and laurent joined me. highlights were iris and harold
car fair in pretoria with deon and jaden
cooked badjias, xiguinha de cacana and pudim with dorcia and emmah
binos out and watching humpback whales from the dunes
binos out and watching humpback whales from the dunes
longboard surfing at the tofo point break
binos out and watching humpback whales from the dunes
urko and i rented a sea kayak to to see some whales up close. was lots of fun but we did almost sink because the kayak was definitely made for one person, not two. surfed it back into shore
went on a hike in hopes to see whaleshark and very surprisingly found two of them. tried to swim out to them but was not able.
longboard surfing at the tofo point break
wandering barefoot through the local market. chatting with random people and learning about different board games they play in mozambique
had a stray dog crew on the beach that i would spend everyday hanging out with and playing with. best part about vilankulos
went for a wade through the water to get to a huge sandbank. snorkeled a bit to see things

bribed some fishermen way too much money to try and swim with whales. the other girl was worst to go with and forced us to go back in early so i didnt get to swim with any. and paid a lot of money. what a waste
longboard surfing at the tofo point break

hopped in a 2 person kayak and paddled for kilometers. followed along with a two adults and a calf and got super close. tried to swim to see some, but wasn't able to because of bad wiz, even though i got close. was an amazing time
longboard surfing at the tofo point break
biked through a game park. saw lots of nyala, wildebees, zebra and some crocs. some of the biking was across cute little bridges
hung out all day in the hammock watching over a watering hole with multiple pairs of rhinos around. they came within 10m of us. close to sunset, walked along side them as they left
hung out all day in the hammock watching over a watering hole with multiple pairs of rhinos around. they came within 10m of us. close to sunset, walked along side them as they left

hung out all day in the hammock watching over a watering hole with multiple pairs of rhinos around. big tower of giraffe spent the day close to the camp. some rhino came almost right up to the fence. what a view to play some cards
amazing cultural dance festival. met some young swazis and danced with them. met some zulu chiefs and danced with them. only one marriage proposal. ended in torrential rain
bought a drink at the highest local pub in africa, crossed the border with it and drank it at the highest actual pub in africa while overlooking sani pass
penguins everywhere! some boulder crawling required. got really close to them. they are so cute!
bit of a walk through the botanical gardens. ended up being surprisingly emotional of a time
caught some nasty waves in muizenberg. so much fun. rochelle joined us
